page.title: 16WOODHAM BURN.
page.content: Woodham Burn is a stream that runs into the River Skerne. Sometimes, if you are lucky, you may see some water rats.You can also see many birds, including house martins and blackbirds. In a fallen tree there is a wasps' nest and a yellow and black, stripey snail shell. Also to be seen are slugs and thousands of midgies fly around the banks. Froghoppers can be seen on the plants around the banks. Amongst the garbage in the stream are golf balls, bricks, drain covers and shopping trolleys. Quite a selection of beetles live there. There are greenfly for ladybirds to live on. Cabbage white butterflies are common along with some other species of butterfly. Not many fish, apart from the occasional stickleback, live there because of the constant dumping of rubbish. Isn't that a shame?
